alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Columbiana; Harrison; Jefferson; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:42AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT HARRISON...NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHWESTERN COLUMBIANA...CARROLL AND TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 430 AM EDT... At 342 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Philadelphia, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Uhrichsville, Cadiz, Carrollton, Minerva, Dennison, Strasburg, Sugarcreek, Augusta, Salineville, Gnadenhutten, Malvern, Tuscarawas, Hopedale, Scio, Midvale, Mineral City, Jewett, and Bergholz. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 75 and 92. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EDT for east central Ohio.
